results.description:
Welcome to NYCIR, the best indie scene in Manhattan for liberty-minded New Yorkers!

Eat, drink and fellowship with NY'ers who value their inalienable right to life, liberty and pursuit of happiness. Our ‘indie’ label suits all who wish to promote their freedom in a voice that's distinct from the big franchise GOP types.

Tired of being defamed by the Left and misrepresented by the Right? Interested in becoming a better communicator, marketer and agent for Liberty? 

Then join our growing eclectic coalition of Ex-Liberals, Free Marketeers, Free Thinkers, Constitutionalists, grassroot strategists and upstarts whose vision of Liberty and Republicanism coincides with Enlightenment Thinkers such as John Locke, Edmund Burke, Thomas Jefferson, James Madison, Bastiat and Alexis de Tocqueville.

Our Meetups will educate, encourage and embolden you to take the next step in reclaiming your inalienable rights. 

Rediscover the timeless principles that inspired the Declaration of Independence and Constitution; recognize what it means to be a smart advocate of 'Res Publica' and 'Res Privatae'; celebrate the triumphs of capitalism and individual enterprise; challenge the Totalitarian Left's fraudulent, regressive reasoning for a tax driven Entitlement State.

You'll have the opportunity to grow your social and professional network, and foster your activism in local and state politics. Our events are headquartered in various convenient locations in midtown.


First time attendees will receive a copy of the Declaration of Independence and Constitution.

“Where an excess of power prevails, property of no sort is duly respected.
No man is safe in his opinions, his person, his faculties, or his possessions."
~
James Madison
Author, US Constitution & Bill of Rights
Original (Indie) Republican

Join Now or follow us @ Twitter

results.description:
Welcome to the NYC Latino Professionals Meetup!

Networking. Cultural Events. Community Service.

The NYC Latino Professionals Meetup ("NYCLP") is a medium for Latina/Latino Professionals to expand their network while having fun and helping the community.  #NYCLP is a diverse mix of white-collar Latina/Latino professionals: from lawyers and finance professionals to IT specialists and teachers.  Almost all of our members have at least a Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science degree.  Many of our members have, or are pursuing, advanced degrees.

Our Latino membership also reflects the immense diversity within the Latin America diaspora. Our members were born or raised in the United States or in Latin America.  What brings us together is a sense of Latino community and a desire to network and socialize with current and future movers and shakers.

#NYCLP hosts upscale Latino networking events, exclusive cultural events and innovative career development/leadership workshops in New York City and Northern NJ. We also engage in community service projects and organize charity happy hours.  Hence, our events can range from networking and charity happy hours/community service to art gallery viewings, museum trips and nights out of Latin dancing.  We are educated and dedicated to our Latino community, but we are also a whole lot of fun.

Since we seek active and engaged members, we strongly prefer that you are a member of not more than 12 meetup groups.  Membership is at Organizer's discretion. We prefer quality over quantity.

NETWORKING

#NYCLP hosts NYC's premiere Latino networking happy hour!

CULTURAL EVENTS:

We embrace and celebrate our Latino culture!

#NYCLP also hosts/organizes other types of events, including wine tastings, Sunday brunches, Latin dinner, out-of-town trips and nights of Latin dancing.  #NYCLP loves salsa, merengue, bachata. #NYCLP has some amazing dancers who are friendly!  Join Us!!!

It does, doesn’t it? I know it sounds corny but we’ve all heard success calling to us. The question is whether or not we’ve answered the call.

This is the home base of our “Success Calls” seminar and assisted networking series on meetup. We currently have 2 meetings monthly in different locations in Northern New Jersey: Elmwood Park,  and Little Falls - both lunch time meetings

Our goal is to offer you an opportunity for learning and development for yourselves or your staff at an affordable price along with the opportunity to meet and network with other like-minded individuals. Dawn Johnson, our co-facilitator will help you in this process.

We want to offer you “meaty” mini-seminars that you leave feeling that you have learned something new, brushed up on an existing skill or gained additional insights.  Use Dawn's fountain of knowledge to help you connect with others. Network with the other people in attendence.

Whether we have 3 people or 30 in attendance, we want you to feel you have spent your time wisely.

These meetings are pay as you go. There are no membership fees, no obligations beyond the $15 cost to attend each meeting. This does not include the cost of any food/beverage you may choose to purchase (but if you could purchase lunch that’d be great – the venues serve excellent food at very reasonable prices). Simply come to the one you’re interested. Our topics will range from selling skills to cold calling to inside sales and service, to leadership and motivation. We hope you find it worth your while and come back again to which every locations suits you best, to hear which ever topic is important to you. Please tell your colleagues about us.

2 times each month – choose what’s best for you.

Cost
$15 plus your cost of any food/beverages

results.description:
The only reason to join my meetup is if you're someone who wants to know as much as possible about bipolar disorder, especially in regards to how best to thrive with our disorder. I come armed with numerous thorough, expensive and informative Psychiatric textbooks, a few Clinical Psychology Textbooks, as well as numerous excellent books on Bipolar Disorder, which you will have full access to once you join the group. The books alone are worth thousands of dollars. Then I also add to the mix professional, peer-reviewed papers found on PubMed or PsychINFO that address salient issues that those with Bipolar Disorder must face.

I ask for a $40 initiation fee from each member not to cover the costs of the thousands of dollars of excellent written resources that you'd otherwise be without. Rather, I ask for a one-time $40 fee to show your support of my emails reviewing literature that are very easy to read when some of these original documents/textbooks are not written for the general public. In my emails, I also share my personal struggles/insights that come from having Bipolar Disorder myself. You also get stellar email responses from other members who share your passion for knowing as much as possible about what may help us get better while weeding out the junk information that is not credible.

A little more about me. I don't mean to boast, but I feel I must if I am to ask for your money to hear from me. I was a medical student at New York Medical College in Westchester when I was diagnosed with Bipolar Disorder type I. After my diagnosis, I found medical school to be much more of a struggle, especially during my third year when I was suicidally depressed while having to work extremely hard on the wards, only to go home to more studying in a perpetual state of sleep deprivation. Anyone with Bipolar Disorder knows that extreme sleep deprivation and highly stressful environments can make it incredibly hard to thrive with our disease. I'm skipping over a little bit of the story here, but basically I decided to pursue a Psy.D. in Clinical Psychology instead of pursuing a residency in Psychiatry because 1. I would learn psychotherapy much better this way and 2. I would not have to subject myself to a lifestyle that is incompatible with my illness. While there's a bit more to the story, what I shared is a pretty good summary of what happened.

I have a few test scores that I wish to share because I think it helps me justify asking for an initiation fee, while I don't like boasting. On the Psychiatry shelf exam (the test all third year medical students take to assess how well they understand/can properly treat Psychiatric illness, I scored 2 standard deviations above the national mean. That means 98% of the nation's med students scored below me on this assessment of our mastery of Psychiatry. Then in order to apply to the field of Clinical Psychology, I took the GRE Psychology subject test and got a 790 with 98% scoring below me again. The point is I humbly consider myself on the road to becoming a true expert on Bipolar Disorder and Clinical Psychology/Psychiatry in general. This means I can answer a lot of your questions, and I'm a very good researcher so I can almost always look up the answer when I don't know it.

And finally, the $40 buys you the ability to ask me to provide a detailed summary of whatever topic you are interested in, so long as it pertains to Bipolar Disorder or Psychiatry more generally. Since I work for you, I ask for a one-time fee for compensation.

 

Here are the topics that I review on a regular basis:

*The importance of sleep in Bipolar Disorder, including how we can best get ourselves sleeping well

*A review of the things that those with Bipolar Disorder do who thrive that is different from the rest of us. This includes understanding the importance of trying to spot depression or mania as early on as possible, and then act in such a way as to prevent a pathological state from occurring. I believe everyone with Bipolar Disorder who wishes to thrive must play a very active role in self-monitoring and prevention of disease states.

*Reevaluating the nature of hypomania and mania, and how it's different from genuine well-being. I share why I believe living without hypomania (or mania) is ideal for me. I challenge those who are drawn to reexperiencing hypomania or mania to consider the wisdom and how much more rewarding living a symptomless life can be.

*How to thrive with Bipolar Disorder at work and school, and the importance of becoming aware of the cognitive deficits that are common to Bipolar Disorder.

*Everything you didn't know about why lithium and other mood stabilizers are good for the Bipolar brain and how lithium is the best drug for preventing suicide in individuals with Bipolar Disorder.

*Suicide, especially focusing on elucidating how big a problem is it and what can we do to get out of a suicidal situation.

*Understanding how we differ from a "normal" person, even when we are in our "normal" state (aka when we're euthymic).

*The importance of getting regular blood work to prevent organ damage that might otherwise result in extensive damage as this type of organ damage largely occurs silently.

*Thorough review of all medication related to Bipolar Disorder, including efficacy and common side effects. In particular, I focus on antipsychotics, and how best to balance desired effect with the potential for horrible side effects.

*Understanding Bipolar Depression, which is different from Unipolar Depression and generally harder to treat. On average someone with Bipolar Disorder will spend 3x more time in a state of depression than mania.

*The power of Positive Psychology to help with all things Bipolar, most especially when one suffers from depression.

*A review of the major forms of psychotherapies being used for Bipolar Disorder, including efficacy and when they're indicated.

*A review of how Dialectic Behavioral Therapy (DBT) may be a critical component in the treatment of many individuals with Bipolar Disorder.

*Quirky facts about Bipolar Disorder like how on average people with Bipolar Disorder are smarter than the general population, noteworthy characters in history/the media who have Bipolar Disorder, the truth behind the mad genius stereotype, and when are we most creative.

*A review of the neuroscience associated with Bipolar Disorder.

 

I could keep listing topics, but I've probably already overwhelmed the reader with my list. Any member can email me asking for a synopsis on any of these topics or any other topic that you believe is important, and I will respond with an informative and easily readable summary of the salient points. If I drop the ball and do not produce such a response within 3 weeks of your request, then I will grant you a full refund of your initiation fee.

Note: This meetup is currently too small for regular in person meetups, but it is constantly growing so I'm confident in the not-so-distant future we will do in person meetups regularly. That was the primary aim of my meetup when I brought it into inception. In the meantime, if it's in person meetups that you're primarily after, I refer you to the numerous other excellent Bipolar Disorder support groups offered on meetup that are based in NYC. That said, we will do occasional meetups, and, again, I promise in the not-so-distant future we will start doing in person meetups frequently.

I think I finally stopped talking. Thank you for reading this far if you did. And to those who are about to join, I say "Welcome!"
results.name: Bipolars in Transition to a Better Life

This group is about getting together once per month at various restaurants around Manhattan. All that is required is a desire to meet other singles over 40 who share a passion about good food.

The focus will be on restaurants in Manhattan and the most popular type of restaurants: Steakhouses, Fish Restaurants, Italian, etc.

Restaurants selected will be in the $10 - $50 per person range .

There are no meetings, just RSVP that you can make it. It's that simple.

Open to single men and women 40 years old or over.

----------------------

This group will schedule dinner out once per month beginning in September, 2010. RSVPs will be limited to 8 people per month with a waitlist.  This allows members to get to know each other on a more intimate level and we don't get stuck with "group" limitations that restaurants sometimes impose.

When the date of dinner rolls around, simply show up 10 minutes early - outside if it is nice or inside if it isn't, and, we'll get to know each other over dinner.  If you arrive late, reservations will usually be made under my name "Vena Moore."


Billing is simple, everyone pays for their own including tax and tip (15%-20%).  The only other requirements are that you are 40 or over, single, enjoy dining out and making new friends, and, for those who are single parents - this is about the adults so leave the kiddies at home.

That's it. No sales pitches. No forced dating or mix and mingles. The simple act of dining together in the hopes of making new friends.
results.name: New York Singles Over 40 Dinner Club

results.description:
Those of us who love running in Queens get to experience the best of all worlds.  We are in the greatest city in the world, in the most diverse county in the country.  We have fantastic parks in our borough - and even two major airports to carry us to distant races.  We have beaches.  We have challenging hills and shady trees.  We have a Major League Baseball team, a world-class tennis center (and tournament), and have been the home to more people of influence than you can count on all of our hands.  We are runners, and we love Queens.  

The[b] Queens NYC Runners[/b] is a group designed to provide a comfortable, casual, friendly and safe environment for its members.  We organize group runs in neighborhoods throughout the borough.  Some of our runs include training provided by certified coaches.  We also offer access to individual coaching, if that's what you want.  All of our runs are collaborative - regardless of whether you are an experienced ultramarathoner or rarely rise from the couch, you will never be left behind.  We look after each other, believe in helping to foster community and keep each other wanting to return for the next event.  Many of our events end at a local pub or restaurant, to allow us to socialize and revel in our fitness.

This group is run by and for its members.  If you would like to run in a particular area, know of an upcoming race, have a suggestion/question/comment or any sort of concern, please email the organizer.  You are also encouraged to post in the Ideas section or Message Board.

results.description:
Are you a woman with a successful business? If you were to divorce, would you want your ex-husband and his new wife as your business partners?

I didn’t think so.

Sadly, 52% of first marriages and 70% of second and third marriages end in divorce. Any woman entrepreneur who is happily married now—or who plans to get married—needs to understand and manage the business risks associated with divorce.

And that's exactly what this group is all about.

We'll discuss the various techniques that can be used to protect your business from a possible future divorce as well as your options if a divorce is more imminent.

Please remember, if you wait until you are faced with divorce, it will already be too late to implement most preventive measures. To be legally effective, these protections must be in place years before divorce is even a thought—either before you are married, or while you are still happily married. The sooner you take preventive steps, the more likely you will be able to protect your business from a divorce.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meeting.

Thanks - Jeff Landers
results.name: Divorce-Proof Your Woman Owned Business

If you've ever visited Hacker News, you've almost certainly seen the "Show HN" or "Ask HN" posts. Well, it's time to get off the Internet and tell us about it face to face. We'll provide you with our honest feedback, you provide us with a great hack or idea.

We'll give you 5 minutes to show off your tool, hack, library (did you just write a library to access the Meetup API in Go!?), whatever. We're language / software/ hardware agnostic, so it's all fair game.

After you present, it's an open forum. The audience will ask questions and provide feedback. We want to enable as much participation as possible at these meetups, so you'd better be able to take criticism and dish it out (all within reason of course).

Our mailing list has a strict no recruiters and no promotion of commercial projects policy. If you think that your message to the list might not be appropriate, either run it by the organizers, or don't send it! Violators will be banned as soon as possible--no questions asked!

The Hack && Tell community has spawned some other interesting meetups:

results.description:
Speed-dating can be expensive. The entry price alone is around $35 to $40, and then you have the drinks and transportation... This would all be fine if you felt pretty sure you were going to meet your one-and-only that night, but often you simply need to go a few times to come across the person that's right for you.

Don't get us wrong - we're huge fans of speed-dating. We think it way better than online dating, as you can not beat a quick face-to-face encounter to establish if the chemistry is right. We'd just like to make it a little cheaper, especially in times when we're all being conscious about what we spend our money on. And remember, the product is actually you, and the other 30 fabulous NYC singles attending - why should we pay $40 for that.

Our aim is simple - we want to inform our members of cheap or free spots at speed-dating events, and/or ensure that you're enjoying a free or inexpensive drink or appetizers while you there.

This is not as hard as you might think. Unlike other singles events, speed-dating companies must almost exactly balance the number of men and women attending. It's not uncommon(for example) for a speed-dating company to be short eight women aged 28-37 the night before the event. They contact us, we shoot for free or maximum $10 spots, and everyone is happy.

Now, here's the catch. We need you to play your part - in other words, if you rsvp to say you want to come, then you do need to show up. And at the event, as many of the participants will have paid full price, then to avoid any grumpiness, we would ask that you don't share your discounted or free rate.

So if you're someone who is single and looking to date, is budget conscious, and can be a little flexible and spontaneous when offers come your way, then this Meetup group is for you! And there is no downside to joining - we'll simply inform you of free or cheap spots, and if you want to come, you rsvp. We will then contact you to let you know if you have a spot (i.e., you don't have a spot just by RSVPing here, you have a spot once you register with a free or discount code on the speed-dating site).

Looking forward to helping you get dates!

Jen
results.name: New York City Free Speeddating Group

results.description:
Black feminism, Latina feminism, indigenous women's feminism is about harnessing the power of women of color as agents of knowledge and as agents of change. By coming together as women of color, as self-defined, self-reliant individuals confronting race, gender, sexuality and class oppression, it speaks to the importance that knowledge and solidarity plays in empowering ourselves and other oppressed people.

Sisters, this group is for women of color who wish to come together in dialogue and in authentic forms of support and affirmation. It is a group to help us move our feminist ideology out of our intellectual minds and heads into our day to day work and lives. It is a group committed to the affirmation of feminist/womanist thought and to moving beyond critical thinking to actual strategy and action.

The artist, poet, social worker, non-profit leader, community organizer, mother and other....YOU'RE INVITED! Join us and network, share ideas, outrage, and stories, and discuss strategies for empowering ourselves and for empowering others.

results.description:
Do you enjoy wine?  Learning?  An expert?  Are you 30+ and looking for a way to meet down to earth people who share your enjoyment of wine? 

About every 6 weeks, the Manhattan and Astoria Wine & Social will either put together a food and wine dinner, find a great deal at a good wine bar, or even just go to a good wine bar.  If you are looking for relaxed folks who can find no better way to start or end and evening than with good wine, you have found the place.

We are non-discriminatory on geography (we don't care where in Manhattan and the boroughs we go), non-discriminatory on wine (although we lean toward red), non-discriminatory on type of food, and occasionally might go crazy and choose a non-wine liquor event!  There is though only one thing we discriminate on, we must have quality wine, and only good wine. 

We are always looking for bars with great wine lists (Domaine, Crescent and Vine), and good solid BYOB restaurants as well.  We like themes and of course good food with our wine. 

 

So for 2013 we are looking at the following plans:

Return to Domaine (LIC) and Claret (Sunnyside) as both were spectacular events in 2011/2, and Terroir again. 

Spanish dinner for $40 including wine (no kidding)

Try a couple of odd regions or grapes (haven't decided yet, but 2011 Croatia was fabulous)

2013 3rd Annual Furniture in the Yard July/August Soire

2013 vertical tasting (TBD)

Private Boutique Tasting

Occasional Field Test (where not even the organizers have been)

Send us your ideas, and if anyone wants to help organize, we can always use your help!


Welcome!
results.name: Astoria and Manhattan Wine & Social

results.description:
WHO ARE WE?

We are a diverse meetup group providing a platform for New Jersey singles (male and female) over 40 to meet other singles for friendship or maybe even find someone special, while participating in fun activities. We know it can be difficult taking that first step to get out there and meet people you don't know. However, by providing fun, social events in a comfortable, non-threatening atmosphere, we can take that step together. You've got an automatic built in set of friends! This is YOUR meetup group and it is only as good as its members. We welcome all suggestions for activities and possible venues, and we encourage people from all ethnicities and backgrounds.

 

In order to ensure a pleasant experience for all, please note the following:

 

RSVP YES ONLY

We are a RSVP YES ONLY GROUP. Please let us know when you are able to attend an event by responding Yes. If you are unable to attend, please do not RSVP No--There is no need to respond. (Can you imagine if we received 120 No’s and 20 Yes’s? The event would certainly look unpopular and no one would be interested in going.)

 

CHANGING YOUR RSVP YES TO NO

If you RSVP Yes and can't make an event, please change your RSVP to No. It is a policy of this groups that anyone who RSVP's to a dinner event and does not show will be removed from the group. This is especially important when reservations have been made with a restaurant and there is a waiting list. Please be respectful of the organizer and the other members.

 

BE CAREFUL!

By attending any of this group’s events, you are assuming responsibility for your own safety. Everyone should drink responsibly, and make sure that you are physically able to attend strenuous activities like bowling, tennis, etc.
results.name: Over 40 Fun Loving Singles in New Jersey

topics.name: Use LinkedIn to Market Your Business

results.description:
Welcome to the Social Media for Small Business MeetUp Group!

The agenda and goals for this group are to learn the techniques, tools and tips to help your business grow and prosper on the web. There is a lot to know and the digital landscape is changing every week. We will extend invitations to attend workshops and panels with industry professionals, insiders and influencers willing to share their knowledge and services in the world of social media and selling via the social web. We will also present webinars, Twitter chats and YouTube Hangouts to help you stay up to date. Ultimately we all seek to be ahead of the curve. Social media is one of the most timely ways to exchange the actionable intel that can propel our endeavors.

The topics small business owners are finding helpful in social media and online marketing are primarily Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and blogging. We will cover those as well as the growing areas of content and video marketing. Other helpful events will focus on digital advertising logistics, accounting and financial planning.

We also schedule events like art shows and movie premiere passes because building a social network is not all about analytics, backlinks and seo. Often times its about getting to know people, feeling comfortable with others that have similar goals and even having fun while developing strong business relationships.

Feel free to reach out to us via the social links you use the most or hit us up here (after all, MeetUp is a social network too)! 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jottDMuLesU&feature=youtu.be
results.name: Social Media for Small Business

results.description:
Welcome to the Young Naturists America meetup group!

YNA is a nudist / naturist organization founded in 2010 by Jordan Blum & Felicity Jones. The goal of our organization is to promote naturism and social nudity as well as to educate. We also aim to raise awareness of social issues that are important to us. We advocate for causes such as acceptance, tolerance, positive body image, top-free equality and anti-bullying to name a few.

What is nudism / naturism? The practice of going naked either alone or in social settings, without overt sexual behavior. We do many of the same fun activities others do every day, just without clothes! ie beach meetups, swimming, hiking, body painting, dancing, partying, sports, & more. Naturism, or nudism, is not about sex or sexuality, and many of the same behavioral rules apply as in any other public social setting.

We are based in NYC and organize events in the northeast as well as in other regions through our YNA chapters. This group will primarily be for events in NY, NJ, PA & throughout the northeast.

We welcome everyone regardless of appearance, ethnicity, sexual orientation, piercings, religion, gender identity, etc. This group is for naturists of all kinds, from people who grew up with it, to people who would just like to see what it's about.

BEFORE YOU REQUEST TO JOIN: Please have a face photo of yourself on your profile and make sure to put some thought into our membership questions. We will not accept one to two-word answers on every question. Thanks!

NOTE: Meetup is not an accurate measure of how many people are attending an event, nor of our gender ratio. We use many platforms to promote events / meetups, and many of our members do not use Meetup. While 12 people might RSVP here, the actual event might have upwards of 80 people.

http://youngnaturistsamerica.com
results.name: Young Naturists / Nudists America (YNA) meetup group

results.description:
"Meditation is an adventure, an adventure into the unknown -- the greatest adventure that the human mind can take." - Osho

If you want to live a more fulfilled life, first you will want to know your potential, who you really are. Meditation is the route to that knowing.It is a methodology of science of awareness.

Many meditative techniques require one to sit still and silent. But for most of us accumulated stress in our bodymind makes that difficult. Before we can hope to access our inner powerhouse of consciousness, we need to let go of our tensions.

Osho (1931-1990) is an enlightened mystic who has given many new techniques of active meditations for the inner transformation of the modern man. His active meditations like Dynamic meditation, Kundalini meditation, Nadabrahma meditation are scientifically devised to consciously express and experience repressed feelings and emotions, and learn the knack of watching our habitual patterns in a new way.You can find out the science behind some of Osho meditations by clicking here

Osho's techniques give more freedom of expression. At our Meditation Studio , we dance, sing, relax, play, create, and celebrate life with the meditation techniques devised by Osho. And while we each can walk this journey of life, of meditation alone, it is more supportive ,more fun, more energetic and vibrant to share the process with others in a group.

Come share the cosmic dance....a dance where individual energies meet and unite with the cosmic energy !!!

For more information on osho meditations visit  below

http://www.osho.com/Main.cfm?Area=Meditation&Language=English

Listen 24/7 Osho Live at http://radio.osho.com , Iphone or Android Osho Apps available too.

For Osho News :-  http://www.oshonews.com

Other Popular Sites :-

http://www.oshoworld.com

http://www.tapoban.com/

results.description:
Purpose:

Are you looking to expand your social circle through Manhattan night life or NYC adventures? Do you like to go for happy hour specials, brunches, and parties? Perhaps experience trips to museums, shows, malls, shops, beaches and more? Or are you new to NYC and need to make new friends? If so, then this is the right stop for you! This group is re-done to bring together groups of old and new contacts into festive events to establish genuine friendships and great memories. Whether it's to mingle, network, catch up, or chat, it is the aim to have meetup members and their guests feel comfortable and excited at a sociable atmosphere.

Target Audience:

Mostly women but screened males are encouraged to join (sometimes few male friends can be invited to events, not all through membership but those are either group assistant organizers or promoters, trusted friends or guests of members). As the group was originally designed to welcome ladies only, I am strict but flexible to those who wish to bring a male guest that could contribute to the group. The group offers a variety of invites from relaxing happy hours or brunches to dance parties or enjoyable trips so those who want to connect or make new friends can benefit.

Summary:

Please feel free to contact me if you have questions, recommendations, and any people you would like to invite to the group. Kindly update your rsvps as often as you can and message if you'd like to co-organize any meetups. Let's get this Fiesta (Party) Group rolling!

Note: There is no cost for the membership or events but DONATIONS are welcomed and you can contact me on how to give for the expenses I make for the group, thanks.

PS: I welcome ideas and suggestions from members so that we could share interests even if I have years of experience leading events!

Rules: No soliciting and no negative feedback, thanks.

These activities don't have to be just yoga or meditation or some philosophical discussion. We can find many ways to enjoy the very best of what the universe is offering around us. We will find ways to interact and learn from each other in our meetings & events.

results.description:
Divorce is one of the most emotionally difficult experiences you will face. We all need support, encouragement and something to look forward to as we go through these challenging times.  This group is designed to work with men and women considering divorce, in the midst of the process or post divorced who are seeking support and guidance to move forward.

In each session, you will find support and validation, be coached through your fears and guided to overcome your obstacles; and challenged to set new goals to begin to move forward. You will develop a community of friends who share your struggles and understand your pain and dreams.

We will be consistently inviting and encouraging you to embark on a journey of surviving, discovering, embracing, dreaming and living full out.

We are New Yorkers (and expatriates) who are troubled by the rapid and continuing decline of the ecosystem and want to make a change, starting by reducing our own impact on the environment. results.description: The mission of this group is exactly what the name implies, we want to provide good company and a positive atmosphere to experience those things that, for whatever reason, you either weren't able to do before or don't get to do often enough. To work toward that, we try to offer a wide variety of things for you to do with us. We try to cater to the interests of as many people as possible. But we are few and you are many, and this means to do what we want as well as possible, we need your help. Feel free to email me with any suggestions you might have. We won't do everything, but I can promise that we'll give everything fair consideration. This group is special because of its members, and I look forward to meeting and building new experiences with as many of you as possible. Hope to see you soon!

I wanted to start this group to reach out to more people in need of a whole food cleanse, whole food supplement regime, healthy balanced diet right for their blood type and constitution and those who want to use herbal remedies to address their health challenges instead of medication.

The purpose of this group is to provide you with the correct health information, offer you professional support and encouragement to make the necessary changes. I will supply you with professional high-grade Physician recommended products to ensure you achieve your goals.

You should join this group if you are committed to heal yourself, if you have tried many cleanses, supplements, herbs and not much have worked for you because you had no professional guidance and customization and if you are open to address the underlying root cause that is preventing you to have the health and life you deserve.

results.description:
I have to be honest with you, I’m not the best networker. It requires an extraordinary amount of time and skill that I seem to never really have. I do, however, have a keen interest in a group where business owners can share their ideas, their triumphs, and failures if they like, so that others can learn and advise.

Most networking groups have people state what they do, over and over each meeting. If I’ve met you once, chances are I have an idea what it is you do. What I really want to know is what is the latest great thing you did for a client, what is the latest great client “Get” you made, what is the latest marketing strategy you are using that I could possibly try. Also, I want to know, as a business owner, what do you think of my business idea, my marketing idea, my strategy? These are the conversations I am interested in having. These are the conversations I think will yield better results for me and for all involved.

I’d like to start an informal group around this idea. I would also like to start the group with Female Hispanic Small Business Owners. The reason for this is simple familiarity. I am a part of an online community of female Hispanic bloggers and the generosity of spirit is tremendous. Additionally, if there is anything I can do, in even the most minuscule of ways, to help any Female Hispanic Small Business Owner would be great.

I’ll be holding the meetings in the morning hours, 8-9:30 am, in my office, twice a month.
results.name: The New York Female Hispanic Small Business Owner Meetup

results.description:
Dances: Every Saturday morning
Time: 10am to noon
Location: Dance Theater Workshop, 219 West 19th Street, between 7th & 8th Aves., 3rd Floor, NY, NY 10011
Fee: $15 (full-time students with valid ID, $10)

5Rhythms founder Gabrielle Roth says: "Put your psyche in motion, and it will heal itself." This meditation practice can heal body and soul through expressive dance movement through five energies or beats: Flowing, Staccato, Chaos, Lyrical and Stillness.

Using music from around the world, this freestyle dance helps us navigate the constant change in our lives, express ourselves clearly and shed what we don’t need, so we live more consistently from a peaceful, yet free, place within us. It’s a workout for the body and spirit and can catalyze deep healing.

Open to everyone, regardless of age, size, gender or physical ability -- it is for those with bum knees or broken hearts! Wear exercise clothes you can sweat in and bring a bottle of water. We dance barefoot or in dance/jazz shoes. No chewing gum, socks, or perfume/oils/cologne on the dance floor.
results.name: 5Rhythms® NYC, Saturday Mornings

Having you been learning about ways to make money on the internet and need a little boost to put the pieces together? We can help you do that. No need to be alone doing everything yourself, you will never get far alone. Look at any Super IMer, they ALWAYS have partnerships with different people.

We hope to see you at the next Meetup!

New York Viral Media Meetup Crew

results.description:
Do you love to Scrapbook, but never find the time to work on your albums? Have you been wanting to start an album, but don't know where to start.

Then join our group every Thursday at Starbucks in Long Beach for uninterrupted time to work on all your photo projects

We are traditional and digital scrapbookers of all levels. Beginners are welcomed

At each of our meetups, you will meet new friends to share photo ideas or projects.

Quick and easy tips and techniques will be shared to save time and complete all your photo projects

Tools will be on hand to try and use

If you have photos sitting in drawers, envelopes or on your computer, then bring them to our meetup. Getting your photos organized is the first step to fun and easy scrapbooking

If you have been wanting to try out digital scrapbooking, then bring your laptop and memory card to try out digital layouts and ideas

Our photos are our precious memories which we try to capture each time we use our cameras



So, join me and my other storytellers to create albums - traditional or digital, which we can pass down to generations to come.

We have free workshops at Starbucks in Long Beach on Thursday nights. Expanded workshops for nominal fees are once a month and large events twice a year

RSVPs required. NO soliciting please!

results.description:
The NYC Acoustic Guitar Forum is for people who aspire to learn to play the guitar.  Perhaps you've tried to learn on your own, or you've taken lessons in the past without success.  This group is for you!!!

There are many other groups in the NYC area where you can meet and network with other musicians, have sing-a-longs, and have jam sessions, etc. All of that is available in this group.  However, what makes this group unique is that rather than leaving learning up to chance, we intentionally focus is on high-quality lessons for Beginners, Intermediate and Advanced level players! As a member of this group, you will have the opportunity to learn and master the fundamentals of playing the guitar!  You will be much more effective at jam sessions, and in what you are able to actually accomplish as you participate in activities in the other groups you join!!  And yes, as you develop and expand your ability to play with groups and other musicians, you'll also have access to Jam Sessions, and be able to network with other members of this group.

Anyone at any skill level is welcome to join the group. The one primary rule for membership in this group is: you must have a profile photo that clearly shows your face.  If you are not recognizable from your profile picture, you will be removed from the group without further explanation.   Please click this link to Read BEFORE you Join!!

Bring your acoustic guitar to participate.  I have a limited number of instruments members can use if you prefer. And if you do not have an acoustic guitar, I can assist you in getting brand new, high quality, acoustic guitar of your own at a reasonable price.  Space is limited, so register for the workshop you wish to attend early. 

Get more info at these links:

• Workshops Offered

• Frequently Asked Questions
results.name: The NYC Acoustic Guitar Forum

best,

Pat Sheridan, organizer

results.description:
All across the globe, everyone is seeking new sources of energy. Meanwhile, the most transformative energy of all is hiding in plain sight. It's natural, sustainable, and infinitely renewable. It's called Inner Energy. And everyone already has it — including you.

Sahaja Meditation is a simple technique that lets you tap into that energy and harness its power to become better balanced and better connected to yourself — emotionally, physically, and spiritually. If you're having trouble juggling the challenges in your life, Sahaja Meditation can help you manage stress, master your emotions and find solutions to your problems. You'll enjoy better health, better focus, and a deeper understanding of the universe and your place in it.

Meditation is not just for mystics and monks. Sahaja is for regular people, too. Anyone can do it. It's that easy. But the Sahaja experience, you'll quickly realize, isn't your typical Meditations 'R Us class. It's much more than just feeling peaceful and relaxed. Sahaja Meditation has many layers, varied and deep. Explore at your own pace, in your own way. And our experts are always available to help.

Ready to plug into your inner energy? A Sahaja Meditation class is a great way to start. A few minutes of your life may be all it takes to connect to your inner energy and light the path to lifelong transformation. Sahaja is more than a temporary solution or quick relief— a journey, rather than a destination. It's all about energy — guaranteed pure and carbon neutral. You can never have too much of it. And with Sahaja Meditation, you can always make more.

The best part? All classes are free. No strings, no catch. There's nothing to buy, now or ever. And everyone is welcome. Bring a friend, bring your kids — we welcome all ages. After all, who couldn't use a little more energy?

For more, visit www.sahajameditation.com. Sahaja Meditation is a not-for-profit offering free spiritual meditation guidance in more than 75 countries worldwide.
results.name: Sahaja Meditation at Hackensack

New York! There's no other place like it! There's so much to do here: an endless stream of options which include meeting new people and expanding our horizons. Who doesn't love dining out, fun times, good conversation and of course, networking to improve our professional and personal lives?

Please make it a point have fun every day!

 

Zorka Kovacevich

results.description:
Looking to share your business experience? Our future is based on delivering results for our members. Join us, so we can show you how we build trusted relationships. Sales pitches (or giving UN-solicited information about your business) is discouraged. Having said that, if you have a question about your sales pitch as such is encouraged. There in, lies the essence of our group, not buying or selling, yet discussing and learning how to produce,process buy and sell in order to elevate our business/skill set.

Lead generation, is not a good reason to join or attend. After years organizing this group, a good number of people (including myself) attending having found that the leads generated within the group are minimal. What others have shared (I've experienced) is that the connections made, have lead to opportunities.

So, North Jersey Small Business Networking (NJ-SBN) mission is to give business owners a place to improve business methods. Some members call us a self help group of owners or a "master mind" group. We want to understand "Why" you are in the business you are in, rather than learn about your product or service. We love hearing about great business methods and horrible ones also. This helps us learn how and why to trust you, after that much more is possible, join in.

If you want to learn about Social Networking we are the only group that views itself (or at least I do) as a social network experiment, education by doing and learning. We are learning about different tools available to increase the efficiency of networking. Being transparent and encouraging members to discuss, question and give feedback is a driving factor for NJ-SBN. Every member will learn something different, some will gain and others will give. Each week with different members the group is always changing, and brings in new opportunities.

We have been developing this community for over 3 years, in anticipation of your membership, we'll be waiting for you on Friday.

Thanks for time, I invite you to join us.

Respectfully,

Steve Navazio
results.name: Small Business Advice and Assistance

results.description:
The Interracial Dating Group is for single people who are interested in dating other single people outside of their race.

As much as NYC is filled with so many different races and ethnicities, many of us tend to stay within our own circles which often makes it difficult to meet and date people outside our comfort zone. Now here's a group to bring single people of different races together to get to know each other, mix it up and possibly date or at the very least make a new friend.

However, in order to join and remain a member of the group ALL members nust adhere to a few rules:

Since this is a dating group ask all members MUST post a picture of themselves within their profiles. Let's fact it when it comes to dating looks do count, so please take a minute or two to post a picture of yourself within your profile and let other members see a face behind the words.

We also ask ALL members to please take a few minutes to fill out our Member Questionnaire, this is an important way for you to introduce yourself, tell us about some of your interests and let everyone know what you're looking for, whether it's casual dating, a possible relationship or just friendship.

Also, since YOU are the most important part of our success, we ask ALL Interracial Dating Group members to do the best they can to ATTEND our meetups.

Yes, we all have lives to lead and jobs to make sure the lights stay on, but what's the point in joining a group if you're not going to participate? This doesn't mean that you have to attend all of our meetups (of course you can if you'd like that'd be great!), but since we now meet every couple of weeks (sometimes MORE!), we ask that you try to make it to at least a quarter of our meetups (that's one every couple of months), that seems fair. Remember there are single people out there who want to meet you so come out to one of our meetups and join the fun.

We ask too that all members try to arrive on time to our meetups (which usually last a couple of hours at least) and if there any problems with the group or other members please feel free to contact whoever is hosting that meetup (or myself) and let them know (granted we're all adults and shouldn't need babysitters, but sometimes stuff happens).

Lastly, there is a small $12/annual fee to join this meetup group--in order words, only a dollar a month to take part in our monthly meetups as well as other social gatherings and meet other singles who are interested in dating outside their race, in person!

Once you've joined the group always feel free share ideas, give us feedback, let us know how we're doing and rate our meetups, we want your feedback so we can make the group the best that it can be.

Thanks,

Cleon
results.name: Interracial Dating Group

results.description: This New York City Business Networking Group is where business networking begins. results.description:
What is our Great Books Reading Discussion Group and how do we work?

First we use the methods and texts from the Great Books Foundation. Our method is called Shared Inquiry and all texts for 2015-2016 season are from the second series of the Great Books Reading and Discussion Program.  (You can buy the set of paperbacks and the discussion guide from Great Books.)  Purchasing the texts is a prerequisite for joining the group and reading the text is a prerequisite for discussion.

For a list of the readings for the upcoming year look at the calendar or download the schedule under "More/Files", the menu item at the top of the page.

What is Shared Inquiry and how was it developed? Shared Inquiry was developed by Robert Maynard Hutchins and Mortimer Adler at the University of Chicago in 1947 to help discussion participants explore, interpret and evaluate the sometimes complex and challenging ideas in the great works we discuss. It is an intellectually rigorous activity that focuses on the interpretation of meaning within the written texts. It is Socratic in style and firmly text based.

In this process participants enjoy the benefits of diverse points of view focused exploration and common discovery.

Each Participant is engaged in an active search for the meaning of the selection at hand. With the energy and encouragement of the group, participants articulate ideas, support assertions with evidence from the text and grapple together with different possibilities of meaning.

How does it work?

There is a “leader” for each selection. The leader has read the text at least twice carefully and has developed interpretive questions—things that puzzled the reader (not questions with specific answers).

It is NOT a free-wheeling exchange of opinions and testimonials which go outside the text. Questions and discussions are always firmly grounded in the text itself.
Here are the basic guidelines:
1. Read the selection carefully before participating in the discussion. Take notes as you read.
2. Support your ideas with evidence from the text.
3. Discuss the ideas in the selection and try to understand them fully.
4. Listen carefully to other participants and respond to them directly.

What do you have to do to join?


1. To join the GreatBooks discussion, contact  Larry Schiff  917 749 0695, larry@larryschiff.com or Tamara Bedić  tamara_bedic@yahoo.com .
2. After clarifying with Larry or Tamara that you would like to discuss the readings based only on what is in the text of the reading, buy the texts from the Great Books Foundation ($28.95 plus shipping and tax) at Great Books.
3. Read the selection carefully as described above.
4. Come in and share (the first Wednesday of each month from 7:00-9:00 PM at the location that Larry or Tamara will send you in an email.) We charge a $5 fee for each meeting to pay for the cost of the room, if you are not a member of the Ethical Culture Society.

Check the calendar for exact readings and dates.

Many of our current members have been in our group for years. Some of their comments are listed in "Group Reviews" in the sidebar.

We look forward to meeting you and having you join our discussions.

Love Classic Rock? Who doesn't? Still, Meetup didn't have much of a Classic Rock presence, that is until now! Enter Classic Rock, NYC!

Do you hope you never hear N Sync's acapella version of, "More Than A Feeling?"

Do you think of The Eagles as a band, not just a football team?

Are you aware that Billy Idol wasn't the first one to do, "Mony Mony"?

Did you know that vinyl can be used for something other than seat covers?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, then this group is for you!

My name is Andy Troy & during the 1980s I was the founder, drummer & songwriter of "The Shades", a popular power-pop band, based in NYC. Because of this, I feel that I'm the right one to bring Classic Rock to Meetup.com! Check out "The Shades" MySpace page: http://www.myspace.com/theshadespowerpop

Some of the events you'll be invited to include:

1) I host "The Andy Troy Show", a weekly radio show about interesting people & events in NYC that is heard from 8-9PM Mondays on The Centanni Broadcasting Network: http://centannibroadcasting.com/

We currently broadcast in front of a live audience out of Giovanna's, a restaurant on the Upper East Side.

Many well known Rock & Rollers have appeared on the show with more to follow. When I have guests that might interest the group I'll post the show as an event. Admission is FREE!

Previous guests have included:

 

*Tommy James (23 Gold Records!)

Here is our Facebook group with links to past shows & pics of all our guests:

results.description:
NewJerseyR

NewJerseyR will be a free informal event, held quarterly and intended to serve as a platform for all local (and regional) R users to present and exchange their experiences and ideas around the usage of R.

A typical meeting will consist of 3-4 talks of about 20-25 min to give plenty of room for sharing your R experiences, discussions and exchange of ideas.

What is R?

R is a language and environment for statistical computing and graphics. It is a GNU project which is similar to the S language and environment which was developed at Bell Laboratories (formerly AT&T, now Lucent Technologies) by John Chambers and colleagues. R can be considered as a different implementation of S. There are some important differences, but much code written for S runs unaltered under R.

R provides a wide variety of statistical (linear and nonlinear modelling, classical statistical tests, time-series analysis, classification, clustering, ...) and graphical techniques, and is highly extensible. The S language is often the vehicle of choice for research in statistical methodology, and R provides an Open Source route to participation in that activity.

One of R's strengths is the ease with which well-designed publication-quality plots can be produced, including mathematical symbols and formulae where needed. Great care has been taken over the defaults for the minor design choices in graphics, but the user retains full control.

R is available as Free Software under the terms of the Free Software Foundation's GNU General Public License in source code form. It compiles and runs on a wide variety of UNIX platforms and similar systems (including FreeBSD and Linux), Windows and MacOS.

This information and more can be found at http://www.r-project.org/
results.name: NewJerseyR

results.description:
This meetup was established with the hope of recruiting new members to join our core group of football players. As a group we have been playing regularly for the past few years. But as time goes by we've lost more members than have joined due to family, jobs, life, etc.

Our member's love of the game and sportsmanship remain. We play a competitive but relaxed game. We welcome new members and integrate them into football extremely well due to our relaxed nature. We teach and encourage members and treat them with respect. That means not degrading ppl for dropping passes, failing to run routes, etc. Everyone's a newbie at some time and we appreciate that ppl are willing to come out and spend their time with us. This is, after all, a game for FUN!

A new member noted to me "Wow it's great that it's competitive yet fun. I was in other groups whereby people would scream and yell at one another which made the games less than fun." We have guidelines established that resolves conflicts, disagreements quickly. We will kick off any person who is belligerent or degrades others. Fortunately we haven't had to come across this thus far.

As I noted we do play regularly. Ever since we joined meetup we've had many new members. We play pretty much every Sunday at 9AM and we usually have enough people for a full game. We try to get two separate games going at once when we can get 20 people. At our current pace that shouldn't be a problem at all.

We play two hand touch football. We normally play 6 on 6, just QB and receivers. We don't do linemen, kickoffs, flag football, running plays as to reduce injury risks. We've played these previously and tailored our current game to increase the fun and decrease the risks. Games are played until someone scores up to 7 points. If we have two separate games going the winner of each game plays the other to add in a little variety.

For those that don't have a car then please contact our leadership team. We can likely pick you up from a nearby train station. After the first game we can try to get another member to share a ride.

In conclusion, if you're looking for a fun game with competitive but relaxed people then come to our game. You'll have so much exercise your muscles will hurt the first week but you'll be wanting more afterwards!

results.description:
The networking group that gives you so much more!


NY Connect and Grow Business Networking group is the only group of its kind on Meetup because it allows you to leverage four powerful business tools:

  1. Personal Relationships

    Your net worth is determined by your network! Our facilitated networking events provide a perfect opportunity to form and nurture lasting relationships. We also teach you how to become an effective networker.

  2. Business Education

    Each event features a mini-workshop that focuses on principles you can use to grow your business.

  3. Mastermind Support

    Interact with fellow business owners to find solutions to the challenges you face. Sometimes all it takes is a fresh perspective to solve a problem!

  4. Marketing Platform

    Get a chance to promote your business both in the events through spotlight presentations and on our website (www.BizKriti.com).

Become a power networker
As a business owner or entrepreneur, are you serious about using networking to grow your businesses? Networking matters whether you want new customers, repeat business, referrals or attention of potential investors. However, it is seldom taught anywhere and consequently most networkers fail to get adequate return out of their investment in business networking meetings.

Business networking is not about exchanging cards! There are tools such as elevator pitches, one-on-ones, strategic alliances, follow ups and social media that you need to master. Whether you are a pro or a newbie, our tools help you tremendously in honing your business networking skills. Our events are quality events that help you grow into a power networker who gets real business out of networking meetings. We also strive to create a synergistic referral network for you.

Business education
Knowledge is a business owner’s biggest asset. Our workshops give you practical tools to help you maintain an edge in the highly competitive world of business.

  • Do you know how to set business objectives?
  • How often do you do strategic planning?
  • Would you like to master sales skills?

Dedicated business workshops cost hundreds of dollars and most small business owners do not have the time and money to take advantage of them. That is why our events feature condensed workshops that focus on just one aspect of business. What is more, you get to mastermind as you interact with fellow business owners to find out how the information applies to your business!

Our events
- Mingle with like minded individuals and create strong business relationships.
- Reach everyone in the meetup through elevator pitches.
- Take part in our highly successful interactive educational programs.
- Learn more about the mindset and skills of business ownership.
- Create strategic alliances.
- Become a spotlight speaker and promote your business.

Looking forward to helping you expand your business through referrals and education. Let's make networking work.

Keep learning, keep growing!
Aditi Gautam

Please note: To diversify our group, we are closed for following professionals now:

-Life and Health insurance

-Network marketing
results.name: NY Connect and Grow Business Networking

results.description:
GENERAL INFORMATION:

Long Island Co-Ed Soccer is the area's first and most well established adult co-ed soccer meetup group.  The Club was founded in 2010 and has grown from a small fledgling group to a powerhouse organization with multiple weekly games for men and women who enjoy playing friendly pick-up style soccer.  Long Island Co-Ed Soccer offers all of its members the opportunity to play indoor and outdoor soccer in a fun and very supportive environment where getting a good workout and making friends is top priority.  We frequently host other events outside of soccer,watch matches and attend soccer games together. 

Our games are played in Elmont, Floral Park and at the Hofstra bubble, depending on the time of year and the day of the week. The games are usually permitted full field with large goals but we sometimes have small sided games with Pugg goals.

We also host tournaments about 4-6 times a year.  These tournaments have become epic events within the club with the winners are awarded medals or trophies for their victory.

Our spots open to all members each week on Monday nights at 8:30 pm SHARP.  As the area's premier club, all of our games fill up quickly,especially during the spring, summer and fall.  RSVP is on a first come first serve basis and teams are sent out the night before the game between 8 and 9 pm.  You may RSVP for as many games each week as you want.  The Club has one golden rule - If you RSVP for the game, you must show up for your spot on time. If you change your mind about a game, you must change your RSVP no lather than 8:00 pm the night before the match so that another member from the wait list can take your spot. Please, don't take a spot and not show up as your team relies on your attendance!! If you do this after receiving a warning, you are barred from RSVPing for a month and lose a spot in the next tournament.

In case of bad weather, check the site before you head out, in case of cancellation because of heavy rain or snow.  We try to call the games about 1 hour before the posted start time.


THE LATEST FAll 2014 INFORMATION:
At the present time, there are THREE  options each week:

(1). Friday Night Turf - 10:30 pm, (Hofstra Bubble - Hempstead - Hosted by Dennis).

(2) Saturday morning at 10:00 am (Sewanhaka HS -Floral Park) (Hosted by Dawn).

(3) Sunday morning at 10:00 am (Sewanhaka HS) (Hosted by Tara).

 

Rules of Play:

Please note that all of our events are friendly events where slide talking, aggressive play and abusive language are not tolerated.  Any member who engages in this kind of misconduct will have their membership revoked.   Please also understand that soccer is a contact sport and that while we do our best to make it a fun game, you are assuming the risk of sustaining a serious injury when you play in one of our games.

 

Offsides Rule:

Since we don't have referees, we enforce offsides on an honor system.  Players are expected to always play fairly and this includes playing onside at all times.  If, however, you notice that someone is offside, you may call that player offside.  To enforce this rule, we ask defenders and keepers to be mindful of the rule and to politely enforce the rule at all times. If there is someone posing a particular problem, please notify your organizer and they will resolve if offline at a later time.

 

"Hot Lava" Rule:

When we use the small Pugg goals, you'll notice that we sometimes place orange disc cones in front of the goal to form a bigger perimeter.  No player (including the keeper) is permitted to stand idle inside the box or the "hot lava", unless and until there is play in front of the goal.  The purpose of the hot lava perimeter is to open up the goal and afford more chances for a shot or goal.  The Puggs are small and shots are difficult to begin with.  It's been our experience that having defenders and keepers standing idle in front of the goal greatly reduces opportunities for goals.  If you notice players standing inside the hot lava you may politely remind them of the hot lava rule.  If there is someone posing a particular problem, please notify you organizer and they will resolve it via the meetup site at a later time.

 

Penalty Kicks: are always indirect kicks.
results.name: Long Island Co-Ed Soccer Club

Welcome to NO DRAMA OUTDOORS, we are an eclectic group of outdoor enthusiasts, with the sole purpose of:

*Bringing like-minded, easy going and well mannered people together.

*NO Tolerance for Emotional Drama, Harassment or Discrimination of any kind.

*Trips durations are day, weekend and week long.

*This is a predominant Rock Climbing, Scuba Diving, and Camping group.

*Active participation is required

The No Drama Outdoors is a SEMI-CLOSED and PRIVATE group aimed at intermediate to advanced climbers and divers. New Members are accepted at the request or recommendation of existing and active Members. With very few exceptions!

This group engages in outdoor activities that are strenuous and require intermediate to advanced training, skill and physical levels.

All members engaging in Scuba Diving must be certified by a Nationally or Internationally recognized Diving Institution such as PADI, NAUI, SSI, TSI.

All climbers must be belayed certified, must have their own safety and personal climbing equipment including Harness, Climbing Shoes, Helmet.

HOW TO JOIN THE N.D.O. 
Click the 'Join Us' button and answer questions.

*Events are open to members and their guests only*

**Events are organized by N.D.O. members for N.D.O. members and all are FREE. There may be times when there is a fee to participate in a particular activity (e.g. equipment rentals or admission fees) but you will never be charged for the time our volunteers spend organizing or leading events. **

***All N.D.O. organized activities require a level of expertise, members take part at their own risk and free will, with the understanding that Scuba Diving, Climbing and other strenuous physical activities carry an inherent potential  for injury and may be dangerous, if not properly trained, by not taking proper safety precautions, nor following established safety guidelines. N.D.O. shall not be held legally responsible for any injuries or unforseen events.

results.description:
Dating With Dignity is a community of like-minded cool people who want to FIND LOVE and RELATIONSHIP in 2010! Our members are tired of hoping that Mr. or Miss Right will just magically appear one day at Starbucks, the gym or on Match.com and are ready to take ACTION to create change in their lives. They want to stop wasting time with flakes, end the frustration and loneliness that comes from dating men and women who don't meet their needs, and want to learn how to love themselves in the process!

This meetup is open to single women and men of all ages to help them identify and understand their destructive dating patterns, how to change their self concept to attract relationship-minded men and women, and thereby get the love they deserve. Our meetups include live workshops, ongoing classes, telephone classes and much, much more. Want to learn more? Check out our website, datingwithdignity.com for daily dating advice, cool video blogs, free tips and information on all our events! Lastly, our philosophy incorporates how to build self-awareness, tap into your authentic self, and take responsibility for your thoughts, feelings and actions in order to date with dignity.

results.description:
Please join us in our photography workshop: The Art of Intuitive Photography! Each class will be held in an exciting location, and is offered as a 2 hour session, a day trip, or a 3 and 5 day workshop.

The Art of Intuitive Photography is focused on enhancing your intuition in photography, learning how to see differently, and compositional improvement. It is open to all photography levels and all digital cameras (including point and shoot). This is not a technical class, however we will go over basics to those who request/need it.

We will conduct exercises to tune you into your intuition, and learn how to take photos by following it. In addition, we will focus on the differences between looking, observing and seeing. Throughout the class we will give feedback on how to better the composition of your photos. You will notice that by the end of the class you will not only be looking at the world differently, but you will have better photographs to prove it!
Hope to see you soon!

Mindy, Lourdes and Sepia

www.artofintuitivephotography.com

www.mindyveissid.com
results.name: The Art of Intuitive Photography

results.description:
Seems like there's a ton of cool young LGBT folks in Central Brooklyn, but we always have to commute to the city or Williamsburg to meet each other. But central brooklyn - Park Slope, Boerum Hill, Fort Greene, Clinton Hill, Prospect Heights, Flatbush - has its own vibe, and some really great places to hang out, and Park Slope is the center of it all. So, why not hang out with each other here?

This group is not for random hookups or anything like that - just a bunch of LGBT folks getting together and hanging out, making friends. If something more comes of it, great! However, the group isn't here for people to just randomly hookup.

[Also, while I don't want to be the 'age police' or 'card' anyone (I think the 'honor system' works much better), I do think its kinda important that we try to keep this mostly for folks who are in their 20's and 30's, cause sometimes older guys can seem intimidating to younger ones, especially for those just coming out. And I think its important to allow a group for younger folks to serve the needs of that age group. But I recommend starting your own group then, the more the better!]
results.name: Central Bklyn LGBT 20-30's Meetup

results.description:
Shut Up and Write! Meetup is a venue for writers to work in the company of other writers on a regular basis. Writing, whether approached as a profession or as an avocation, is an isolating activity. We provide this forum, writing resources and meeting times as a method of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about ‘writing down the bones’ and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

Meetup Format
Making the time to write one hour per week is an empowering and ultimately rewarding experience but it needs to serve as the foundation of your daily discipline. If you RSVP that you are coming, then please arrive 10-15 minutes before the start of the Meetup. The facilitator will lead introductions and then the group will write for an hour. There will then be 15-30 minutes of social time to get to know each other and possibly discuss personal writing successes such as getting published or overcoming writing resistance in some small way. No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

Writing is the only thing that, when I do it, I don't feel I should be doing something else.
Gloria Steinem
results.name: Shut Up & Write! NYC

topics.name: Parents of Gender Variant Transgender Children

results.description:
Proudly Sponsored by PFLAG NYC

 

 

 

Stepping Stones is a network of families embracing their children’s gender non-conformity in a kind and loving manner. Our support group focuses on providing a monthly meeting place for parents to connect with other families by sharing information and experiences. There are two groups; a parent’s discussion group which is sponsored by PFLAG NYC, and a children’s playgroup which is sponsored by the member families. Monthly meetings are private to protect our young children’s privacy. Meetings are open only to families that have already decided to accept and support their gender different children and only immediate family members are allowed to attend.

 

There is one Children's playgroups up to age 12 and the group is designed to let our kids have some fun and get exposure to other gender-variant kids.  The discussions do not focus on issues regarding such topics as gender, feelings, or  bullying.  Instead, kids are given a safe environment to develop regular friendships through common activities, such as board games, painting, clay modeling, etc.

 

The parents group is designed to let parents share their experiences parenting gender non-conforming children.  We sometimes have guest speakers--therapists, gender-variant adults, or camp counselors. On other occasions, we lead our own discussion on topics such as concerns about safety, frustrations about family members not "getting it", or our own second-guessing how we support our kids.

 

New parents that are still struggling to accept and support their children’s gender identity, but would like to talk and explore with another family, can contact us.
results.name: Stepping Stones

results.description: This meetup is for people interested in learning iPhone and iPad Programming at a competitive price during the weekend (Saturday, Sunday). Topics covered: Creating Apps with iAd capability. Creating Apps that use the motion sensors in the devices. Hardware (accelerometer, touch screen, GPS Receiver, Three axis Gyro, Proximity sensor, Ambient Light Sensor, Retina Display, etc). IPhone OS (Berkley BSD Unix, Core OS & Core Services, Media Layer and Cocoa Touch Layer). Cocoa Touch (Collection objects, controllers, views, API for access to accelerometer, GPS, photo, etc). Objective-C (object oriented concepts, single inheritance, dynamic binding, method dispatch, similarities and diffs with C++ & Java). Xcode (Official and supported IDE for development, enhanced editor, make file, project setup, debugger, integration with simulator, interface builder and instruments). Interface Builder (Graphical Tool for creating App GUI). Instruments (Performance Analysis, Memory Leaks, Timing Charts). Simulator (Testing Apps before actually deploying on device). Debugger (Demonstrate debugging by setting break points and inspect how variables change). Table Views (Very useful and widely used GUI object. Go through some of the more useful functions of the class UITableView). Touch Events (Understand the various touch events, single tap, multiple tap, swipe, pinch, reverse pinch, etc). Memory Management (understand the key words "retain", "release", "delete", class methods, instance methods). Performance (Understand how the tool Instruments can be used to find Bottle Necks in an application, learn how to detect memory leaks). Animations (Examine the animation methods in the UIView class, understand NSTimer). MVC (Understand the Model View Controller Paradigm. Examine the UIViewController Class and the UIApplicationDelegate Protocol). Building simple apps (create sample views that do animations, respond to device motion, process touch events, etc). Publishing to App Store (Understand what is required to publish an App, understand what is required to create Apps that sell). App Store Gold Rush (Understand the various App Store Financial Models). INSTRUCTOR: Dr. Monzurul Ehsan. Companies worked: Credit Suisse, ITG Inc, Centra Software, Fundtech, Lotus, Elcom Systems and Liant Software. Platforms: Mac, Unix, Windows. Programming Experience: 16 years. Languages: Objective-C, C++, Java, C. Companies worked: Credit Suisse, ITG Inc, Centra Software, Fundtech, Lotus, Elcom Systems and Liant Software. Platforms: Mac, Unix, Windows. Universities taught: University of Massachusetts (Lowell and North Dartmouth). Has published several Apps in the App Store. Education: PhD (Electrical Engineering from University of Massachusetts.) CONTACT: Email: support@schooliphone.com Tel: 1-800-337-9701 Address: 8552 168 Street, Jamaica, NY 11432 www.schooliphone.com

Perhaps you are a new immigrant who needs to practice your English or you will be moving to France next year and need to master the language?

Simply answer the profile questions and I will be setting up partners where you will meet once a week in person or via skype or IM (whatever is convenient for the two of you). 1/2 hour will be spent on each langauge so that you both get practice.

results.description:
This group is for people who have been diagnosed (or not) with a mood disorder, are depressed or bipolar, have OCD, anxiety, or are dealing with either recent diagnosis. It's also open to friends, family, and supporters who want to learn about living with a mood disorder and share personal experiences. Here is a good place to start seeking help, or discuss treatment and challenges dealing with diagnosis and living with a mood disoder.


Group discussion can bring tremendous insight into yourself and provide the tools to get through the week, day, month, year. This is NOT a group therapy, just a discussion between people who have been struggling who are looking for feedback, tips, and support while overcoming these incredibly complicated responses to life.


If you lost your job and are feeling hopeless, having relationship problems, are grieving about losing someone close, are feeling lost and sad and need someone to talk about it, are supporting, living with, or have been raised by someone with a mood disorder, and want some insight into dealing with your feelings, or just rant - this is a place for you to get the support and motivation you need, ask questions, and gather the strength to deal with struggles of living with a mood disorder and the stigma from people many of us interact with on daily basis.



We have a resources page with useful information on getting treatment and learning about mental health

Please introduce yourself when you join, and tell me what you want to get out of this group.
