topics.name: Accepting And Celebrating A Childfree Life

results.description:
Tired of losing good friends to the mommy or daddy track after they have kids and then drop off the face of the earth?  Tired of conversations over dinner and at parties being focused on the kids, schools, and  getting home in time to let the sitter go?

I started this group because the vast majority of my friends cannot relate to me on this important part of life: I've never had any interest in being a parent. Most of my friends and family, whom I love, are the opposite. And most do not understand my choice to forego children. Some think I'm selfish. Others take it personally that I have chosen something that is the opposite of what they've chosen. Meanwhile, I enjoy spending time with their children, but I'm always thrilled to go home and enjoy my childfree life. The problem is that most activities that are fun for me are not fun for people with kids. Either they don't want to leave their kids home just to grab a drink after work, or they can't, because they have to go pick them up from daycare, soccer practice, etc.

I do not divide the world into people with children & people without children. But I DO want to meet other adults who want to hang out in the city and enjoy what life here can offer to those of us who have more time, flexibility, and freedom (three of the best words in the English language as far as I'm concerned!)

As the news outlets & pundits talk about the childfree "movement," I just want to enjoy life without being "bingo'd" to death about my lack of interest in being a parent.  I'm exhausted from having to answer the questions about it.

Although there are other childfree meetup groups, all the others I've seen that are in New York City, or near New York City, are not in Manhattan. Several are only for singles or only for couples or only for people in a certain age group. So I started ChildfreeNYC to welcome ALL childfree people!  (We have lots of singles in this group, and lots of couples, and ALL are welcome, as long as you don't pull a lot of "no shows," meaning cancelling within 48 hours of an event. If you RSVP "yes" and then you cancel within 48 hours of an event, or you simply do not show up, you will be marked as a "no show." After 3 "no shows," you will be removed fro the group.

This is a strict policy, but in the many years of running this group, only a handful of people have been removed because most of our members are good about RSVP'ing accurately. So join us!  You can also visit us on Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/ChildfreeNYC

results.description:
If you want to live a more fulfilled life, first you will want to know your potential, who you really are. Meditation is the route to that knowing. It is the methodology of the science of awareness.

Many meditative techniques require one to sit still and silent. But for most of us accumulated stress in our bodymind makes that difficult. Before we can hope to access our inner powerhouse of consciousness, we need to let go of our tensions.

Osho Active Meditations have been scientifically designed by Osho over a period of time to enable us to consciously express and experience repressed feelings and emotions, and learn the knack of watching our habitual patterns in a new way.

At Meditation Studio we laugh, sing, dance, relax, play, create and celebrate life with the support of meditations designed by Osho. Osho has designed various techniques for the modern society that are therapeutic and enlightening. Osho meditations, books and discourses merge eastern and western philosophy and cover many topics including: zen, yoga, kundalni, dance, breathwork, chakras, Tantra, Buddha, Jesus, Zorba, Gurdjieff, Sufi-ism, and so much more.

Come join us for fun in the wonderful world of Osho.

"Osho is an enlightened master who is working with all possibilities to help humanity overcome a difficult phase in developing conscuiousness."  The Dalai Lama

results.description:
Welcome to the NY Mostly Go Club!

The "Mostly" is there since it's fun to do other things besides Go once in a while. For example, dinner or drinks after a tough tournament, a picnic with Go boards under blooming cherry trees in spring, whatever fun things we can think of.

We'd love to meet other people who are interested in the game of igo/weiqi/baduk in the NYC area.

 

Don't know how to play but saw it on some TV show or something and want to see what the game is about? We also host NYAMIGO Beginner's Workshops during our meetups, and everyone else is happy to teach beginners to play at any time.

More experienced players can come and relax over a game, maybe help other players improve. The goal is to have a fun atmosphere and make some friends.

 

For the moment, the primary meetups are the "Beginners Workshops w/ NYAMIGO" This doesn't mean stronger members aren't welcome, they absolutely are. It's just that the other NYAMIGO instructor, Naoki, and I will be spending more time teaching beginners than playing even games that day.

 

For the moment we don't have a regular meeting space, but am borrowing space at Meetup HQ once in a while. You'll have to see each individual meetup to check the location.

 

Members (both new and old) are encouraged to post things, ideas for events, discussions, anything they think would be fun for the group.

The very simple guidelines for posting events is here: http://www.meetup.com/mostlygo/messages/boards/thread/24385382

A very quick list of spaces we often use is here: http://www.meetup.com/mostlygo/pages/Typical_places_we_often_go_to_meet_up/

results.description:
Dear Friends:

I just finished intensive studies in pastoral care and counseling and believe now more than ever, that the last thing we all need is to only attend "church" as it has developed over the years. Although I am the Senior pastor at a wonderful church on the West side of Manhattan in the West Village, I really enjoy sitting together in s a small group.

Perhaps sitting in a pew is not the enemy, however, I have found that sitting together in small groups and sharing with each other various topics, can lead us to a better understanding of ourselves, our situation in life, and more important, the God who loves each and every one of us.

I have also found, that most people who have attended church for years or who call themselves "Christians" really do not understand the teachings of Jesus Christ very well, and have let others "tell them" what religion is all about, when in fact, religion just might be the problem. Remember, Christ had little to do with religion when he walked the earth, in fact, he found himself rejected by the faith community of his time and spent most of his teaching, with individuals and small groups. This is the concept of REACH-NYC, and I know you will enjoy these small groups.

REACH-NYC sponsores The Chapel At Union Square.

We call our gatherings "Conversations" and it is our hope that you will join us for a stimulating conversation on the Biblical issues of the day, and how growth in the teachings of Jesus Christ, can be a refreshing change for our lives.

With this in mind, I am inviting you to explore with me your life story, what God has in store for each one of us and to join us in a safe place to relax, be yourself, say what's on your mind and find a meaningful relationship with God and good, caring friends.

We currently meet at a small intimate venue we rent at The Seafarers International House, 123 East 15th Street, NYC, on the corner of Irving Place, in the Union Square Area of New York City. We meet promptly at 10:00 a.m. - 11:30 p.m. on Saturday mornings. Most people travel by bus or train to get here. There is limited street parking, however, if you do come by car, you can find reduced rate parking on East 18th Street between Third Ave. and Irving Place, on the South Side of the street, as you head East on E. 18th Street.

You will see a sign in the window: The Chapel At Union Square, and depending on the size of our small group, you will find us either on the Mezzanine level in a small conference room. Just take the elevator and press "M" and make a right, where you will find us in the conference room.

If our group grows, you will find us in the intimate chapel. As you enter the lobby of the Seafarers International House, just make a right as you enter the lobby and the chapel will be right there.

We will post signs so you will know how to find us.

I truly look forward to meeting you as we share the love of Jesus with each other and learn about a lifestyle that is all about the greatest teaching's Christ gave to his disciples and can be found in the Word and some great advice from the Apostle Paul, a Jewish believer and Roman citizen who became a follower of Jesus and an advocate for his teachings, that many have yet to fully comprehend.

"A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another. By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you love one another" - John 13:33-35

"Finally, brothers and sisters, rejoice! Strive for full restoration, encourage one another, be of one mind, live in peace. And the God of love and peace will be with you." - 2 Corinthians 13:11

May God richly bless you as you prepare to join us for a time of refreshing and peace. Christ has fully paid the price for our lives to be restored. Salvation is a free gift and what a joy it is, once found.

 

Best Regards - Tony Romeo

P.S.: If you have any questions, please write me.
results.name: REACH-NYC

results.description:
Westchester Sail and Power Squadron ("WSPS") is part of the United States Power Squadron ("USPS"), the world's largest private, non-profit boating organization. Westchester was awarded its Charter in February, 1937. The majority of our members are drawn from Central and Southern Westchester County. The boating activities of our members take place primarily in the Long Island Sound and the Hudson River.

The Westchester Sail and Power Squadron (like all of the squadrons that comprise USPS) is made up of people who are interested in taking classes and seminars to learn about safe boating and who enjoy power boating and/or sailing.

If you are interested in learning about safe boating, we are the right group for you. We have multiple classes and we also have group activities throughout the year.

We also have Thursday night sail which is a lot of fun. We have several boats which go out on Thursday nights for sail from different marinas in Westchester.

If you would like to take part in our Thursday sail, you should:

1. Join WSPS MeetUp Group and become a member of the United States Power Squadrons. 1st year membership is $97 per individual and $133 for the entire family.

2. Send an email to John at jwsteger@gmail.com  at  least 3 days before the sail (Monday) so John can assign you to a boat.   If you can't get that information to John by Monday, he will try to accommodate you but may just ask you to be on the list for the following week.

3.  The email you send to John must provide a phone number where you can be reached.   

4.  Your friends will be accommodated only if there is enough room on a boat.  We will put a max of five people on a boat and that will include one experienced sailor to assist the captain.  So basically we will assign four passengers, one experienced member and the captain which makes 6 in total.
results.name: Westchester Sail and Power Squadron

results.description:
As many of you know, there are several different Chinese meetup groups in New York. At most of these meetups, speakers of all levels are welcome. This means that quite a large percentage of the conversation tends to be in English.

To learn and improve, it's necessary to immerse oneself and not to feel as if you can just switch to English anytime you want. I have started this meetup to create a place where intermediate, advanced, or native speakers can go and speak entirely in Chinese. Sure, you can translate a word or explain something complicated in English if necessary, but other than that, we're keeping it entirely in Mandarin.

You should join this group and come to this meetup if you can have a basic conversation in Mandarin, if you have lived or traveled in a Chinese-speaking country for some length of time, if you have studied Chinese in school or on your own for a while, or if you are a native speaker. Basically, you should be able to speak Chinese to some extent already if you show up here. The whole goal is to keep the role of English as absolutely minimal as possible when we meet.

That being said, if you are intermediate, don't be intimidated. I myself am hardly fluent, but if you have the basics down and want to improve your vocabulary and natural speaking, the best way to do it is to force yourself to use what you know and expose yourself to things you don't!

If you're not sure whether it is right for you, just ask.
results.name: Advanced Chinese Conversation

results.description:
Westchester Motorcycle Club | 914mc™
Website | Facebook | Twitter | Instagram

Westchester Motorcycle Club is an informal, family oriented group of motorcycle enthusiasts who reside in Westchester County, NY. 914mc™ is a social networking club that was created to bring low-key professionals who are interested in meeting like-minded people, regardless of the bike they ride, together in Westchester County for leisure cruises, social events & networking.

914mc™ Members include men & women who are: 

1. residents of Westchester County 

2. low-key individuals 

3. family oriented & kid friendly 

4. professionals (working or retired) 

5. responsible riders

914mc™Associates are non-residents of Westchester County who enjoy riding with Members and fellow Associates. 


Notes:

a) The form and function of 914mc™ will evolve to meet the diverse needs of its growing membership/association of professionals throughout Westchester County.

b) Professionals are men and women who conduct themselves in a manner which is conducive to preserving the integrity of the individual as well as the group they are in while in the workplace or during social gatherings.

Disclaimer:   

By participating, you are acknowledging that motorcycling is inherently a dangerous sport, and that you are riding/participating ENTIRELY at your own risk. You agree to ride safely. Each member/associate participates in activities solely by choice and participation itself relinquishes Westchester Motorcycle Club aka 914mc™ as an organization, and any of its organizers, officers or event organizers, personally and jointly of any responsibility for any and all liabilities resulting from participation in any club related event or activity. All activities and events must comply with federal, state & local laws and ordinances. Any personal injury or property damage occurring during a club activity or during personal travel to or from the activity, becomes the responsibility of the individual parties involved, and at no time shall the 914mc™ or its organizer(s), officers or event organizers be held liable. 914mc™ reserves the right to accept or reject members/associates and to periodically, and without notice, revise or amend rules and regulations where necessary. You are advised to wear a helmet at all times. The 914mc™ organizer(s) encourages you to exercise discretion while using information contained in the 914mc™ Meetup.com website. The organizer(s) makes no representations concerning any endeavor to review the content of sites listed here, or any of the materials, and so the organizer(s) isn't responsible for the accuracy, copyright compliance, or legality of material contained in sites listed or linked from our Meetup.com website. If you agree to all of the above, please join 914mc™ rides and conversations etc.

results.description:
Polski Klub Wysokogórski w USA to miejsce dla wspinaczy Polskiego pochodzenia, oraz wszystkich zainteresowanych nauka wspinaczki i poznawaniem nowych przyjaciól. Planujemy organizowac wyjazdy lokalne (do Gunks, New Paltz, NY) a w przyszlosci takze expedycje w góry. Mamy zamiar tez organizowac spotkania narciarskie, i ski-mountaineering.

Jestesmy aktualnie zarejestrowani w stanie Nowy Jork jako organizacja bezprofitowa.  Prowadzimy tez rozmowy z Poskim Zwiazkiem Alpinizmu (PZA) w celu pozostania oficjalnie zrzeszonym Klubem Wysokogórskim w PZA, reprezentujacym Stany Zjednoczone.

 

Polish Mountaineering Club USA is home for mountaineers of Polish descent, as well as anyone interested in mountain climbing and making new friends. We plan to organize local climbing trips to the Gunks (New Paltz, NY), and in time, more elaborate mountaineering expeditions. We also intend to organize skiing and ski-mountaineering excursions.

Our group is currently registered in New York state as a nonprofit organization.  We are also negotiating with the Polish Alpine Association (PZA) to become an official representative body of PZA in the United States.
results.name: Polski Klub Wysokogórski w USA
